heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 31 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.0°C) and outside temperature (down 3.0°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 7%) and rainfall (down 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.2 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 450.9m higher than yesterday, 108.2m higher than the past week, 40.8m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 696m minimum and 976m maximum, with an average of 1285.4m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1177.2m and 1244.6m.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, pleasant humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Showers, occasional overcast conditions, and a mix of sun and clouds. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (5.2°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
